question: 変
userAnswer: strange/odd | suspicious | unexpected | change | incident/disaster | flat(tone)
activeAnswer: strange/odd | suspicious | unexpected | change | incident/disaster | flat(tone)
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well. This is more the "strange" meaning though, not the "change" one. As in, you <ja>変な猫！</ja>
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the one you learned with the kanji. How strange! Or not.
